Enī：A river．According to the Bakabrahma Jātaka，one of Baka’s good deeds which brought him rebirth in the Brahma-world was that of having set free the inhabitants of a village on the banks of the Enī （Enikūle），when the village was raided．



Baka was then an ascetic named Kesava and the Bodhisatta was his disciple Kappa．S.i.143； J.iii.361； SA.i.163.
